Subject: RE: RSO UAE - POPUP Closure - Devialet - Mall of Emirates - Thursday 23rd Jan 2025
--------------------------------------------------
Hi Everyone, 

 

Good day!

 

MAF is insisting that we finish all the dismantling by 24th evening latest…. We cant do any work on 25th Jan. 

 

Can we please work around that?

 

Here is MAF’s feedback:

 

As discussed, we request your support on the Devialet unit handover back to us on January 24th at the latest without further delays. We will require the time from the 25th onwards in order to strip out the Unit and handover to the next incoming Long term tenant on a timely basis. As this already puts us at a tight schedule for the stripping out and related works, yet we have obtained approval on it in an effort to support you.

Accordingly, re. the below correspondence, should Devialet require more time to remove the merchandise and cameras, etc….kindly schedule the closure earlier and inform us to install the hoarding on the 21st or 22nd depending on our schedule. 

 

To give you background information, all communication received by us was on the basis of being able to move out and handover the unit within 24-hours post closure on the 23rd. We obtained approval on this, knowing that it would be a tight schedule, and planned internally accordingly. Hence, we cannot do further adjustments at this point in time.

Dear All,

 

Thank you for attending the call of today.

 

Kindly be informed that we have a store closure of  “Devialet Mall Of Emirates on Thursday 23rd Jan 2024.

 

You are kindly requested to complete your tasks for smooth closure and arrange the store closure needs as per the individual tasks within the given time frame,

 

*	@Ruel Apostol <mailto:Ruel.Apostol@chalhoub.com>  @Philip Abdou <mailto:Philip.abdou@chalhoub.com>  @Group Security Control Room <mailto:GroupSecurityControlRoom@chalhoub.com>  @Sredha Mathai <mailto:Sredha.Mathai@chalhoub.com>  Please share the documentation at the earliest to store email to apply for permits.
*	Create a Return to warehouse by @Bhavya Bhatia <mailto:Bhavya.Bhatia@chalhoub.com>  and create an appointment/ ASN request trough one reach for all merchandising.
*	Apply for Work Mall/police permit (return stocks, transfer / stock packing/ IT/CCTV Equipment) @Devialet Moe <mailto:Devialet.Moe@chalhoub.com> @Andrei Grapa <mailto:Andrei.Grapa@chalhoub.com> 
*	collect on 24th Jan from boutique : 1000 AED Petty cash , 3000 AED Cash Float, 2 Credit card machine and manual invoice book to be kept for DM Location. @Sarah Hachoumi <mailto:Sarah.Hachoumi@chalhoub.com> 
*	Share the TID/MID CC machines with Ghouse . @Devialet Moe <mailto:Devialet.Moe@chalhoub.com> @Andrei Grapa <mailto:Andrei.Grapa@chalhoub.com> 
*	@Philip Abdou <mailto:Philip.abdou@chalhoub.com>  @Group Security Control Room <mailto:GroupSecurityControlRoom@chalhoub.com>  please ensure all CCTV camera and NVR is dismantled and collected on 25th Jan before trading hours.

@chalhoub.com> >; Chadi Dagher <Chadi.Dagher@3d-consultants.com <mailto:Chadi.Dagher@3d-consultants.com> >
Subject: RE: RSO UAE - POPUP Closure - Devialet - Mall of Emirates - Thursday 23rd Jan 2025

 

Hi Everyone, 

 

Good day!

 

MAF is insisting that we finish all the dismantling by 24th evening latest…. We cant do any work on 25th Jan. 

 

Can we please work around that?

 

Here is MAF’s feedback:

 

As discussed, we request your support on the Devialet unit handover back to us on January 24th at the latest without further delays. We will require the time from the 25th onwards in order to strip out the Unit and handover to the next incoming Long term tenant on a timely basis. As this already puts us at a tight schedule for the stripping out and related works, yet we have obtained approval on it in an effort to support you.

Accordingly, re. the below correspondence, should Devialet require more time to remove the merchandise and cameras, etc….kindly schedule the closure earlier and inform us to install the hoarding on the 21st or 22nd depending on our schedule. 

 

To give you background information, all communication received by us was on the basis of being able to move out and handover the unit within 24-hours post closure on the 23rd. We obtained approval on this, knowing that it would be a tight schedule, and planned internally accordingly. Hence, we cannot do further adjustments at this point in time. 

 

 

Thank you

 

Best regards 

 

SARAH HACHOUMI​​​​
